page.title: 05The Dymock 900 Festival
page.content: Did you know that Dymock was mentioned in the first Domesday Survey of 1086? This year we are celebrating our church's 900th anniversary. Many events have taken place, including a local pageant. People with the name "Dymock" were invited and they came from all over the world including as far away as Australia and USA! One lady was a descendent of one of the Founding Fathers who went to America in 1634. People dressed up as monks and in medieval costumes. One of the main events was a joust and men dressed in armour entertained us with jousting on horseback and sword-fighting on foot. The school children gave a display of maypole dancing. There was roast pig and lots of beer and wine to drink! One of the Dymocks is the Queen's Champion.
